p: Secondary metabolites of the crude leave extracts and crude endophytes extracts were identified using an LC-QTOF system with a Dionex UltiMate 3000 UHPLC (Thermo Scientiﬁc, Darmstadt, Germany) coupled to a Compact™ QTOF (Bruker Daltonics, Bremen, Germany) that uses an electrospray ionization (ESI) interface, following a modified method by Hoffman et al., Changwa et al., Want, Tapfuma et al., and Tapfuma et al. [ 42– 46]. The instrument parameters used in this study are listed in Table 2. Instrument operation control and acquisition was done using HyStar software version 2.1 (Thermo Scientific, Darmstadt, Germany). The analytical run was set at 40 minutes.
